summary: This document is a chain of emails from March-April 2022 between a DOJ OIG Assistant Special Agent in Charge and a Convergint Federal sales representative. The correspondence concerns an inquiry to verify the delivery timeline of a 'Nice Vision' camera system and related equipment to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, which was installed in August 2019. The OIG is seeking to reconcile conflicting information about whether components were delivered in October 2018 or later.

keyFacts: The U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) is investigating the delivery timeline of a security camera system to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.
There is conflicting information: one source says parts were delivered in October 2018, but a March 2019 email says the cameras were not delivered at that time.
The camera system in question was a 'Nice Vision' system installed at MCC New York in August 2019.
The inquiry focuses on validating deliverables from a September 2018 contract and obtaining shipping/receiving reports.
Key vendor personnel mentioned are 'Chris', a Federal Sales Representative, and 'Justin', who possesses the specific delivery information.
